thread.title: A 360-view of Atlanta Falcons at Super Bowl Opening Night
thread.title_full: A 360-view of Atlanta Falcons at Super Bowl Opening Night

author: AJC Sports
title: A 360-view of Atlanta Falcons at Super Bowl Opening Night
text:
The Atlanta Falcons took the stage as a group Monday in the Super Bowl Opening Night Monday at Houston’s Minute Maid Park.
It was a show of solidarity in line with their “Brotherhood” mantra for the 2016 season.
The players then split up on the field to answer questions from a slew of media types.
• Photos: Falcons in spotlight at Super Bowl Opening Night
Matt Ryan handled himself with poise . Falcons owner Arthur Blank had some fun with Patriots owner Robert Kraft .
And Kyle Shanahan lost his backpack with the Falcons’ Super Bowl gameplan .
In all, a crazy scene that always seems to entertain , including Falcons center Alex Mack being offered a Turkey leg. Yeah, it happened at Opening Night.
A member of the crowd offers Falcons center Alex Mack a turkey leg during Super Bowl Opening Night on Monday, Jan. 30, 2017, at Minute Maid Park in Houston. ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
